channel.title: Cpu
channel.description:
CPU
I gotz me a problem. I installed Windows Server 2008 on my old server via USB/WinPE just as a proof of concept. Everything is running nicely until... It decides to stop detecting one of the cpus. Why would it "lose" a cpu in the middle of operation?

item.title: Cpu
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Um maybe your hardware isn’t supported. I don’t know. Maybe the USB key was corrupted a bit.

Read full topic

item.title: Cpu
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:5, topic:301249”][quote author=Starting up … link=topic=397553.msg2951487#msg2951487 date=1252537156]

Because it is windows?

I have a thing against windows too, but that still isn’t a very good reason.
[/quote]Try a core version of Linux. See if the same thing happens? If not, It’s Windows…?

I had debian, ubuntu, xp and 2003 all running nicely. For some reason, it is working again, but I still have no idea why it didn’t work… I do not want it to crap out when under stress.[/quote]I’m going to send you a PM. I want you to answer it.

Read full topic

item.title: Cpu
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Starting up …, post:4, topic:301249”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=397553.msg2951433#msg2951433 date=1252534460]

Because it is windows?

I have a thing against windows too, but that still isn’t a very good reason.
[/quote]Try a core version of Linux. See if the same thing happens? If not, It’s Windows…?[/quote]
I had debian, ubuntu, xp and 2003 all running nicely. For some reason, it is working again, but I still have no idea why it didn’t work… I do not want it to crap out when under stress.

Read full topic
